links.title: Steve Bannon's Flawed History of 1800s Protectionism
links.description: Gage Skidmore In today's Wall Street Journal, Dartmouth College economist Douglas Irwin has authored a lethal takedown of Steve Bannon's flawed theory that protectionism fueled America's economic rise in the 19th century. Bannon makes the double mistake of linking protectionism to "control of our borders," when in fact that era included historic levels of open immigration to the United States.

links.title: 10 Cheap Consumer Stocks for an Uncertain Market
links.description: For a few days, it looked like the market might get back into a "risk on" mood again, favoring growth names regardless of their frothy valuations, at the expense of consumer-oriented stocks regardless of their all-weather reliability. Now the question is back on the table. Or, maybe it was never really off the table.

links.title: AAPL finds buyers at key support level
links.description: Highlights Report Sentiment: 25% Bearish Overview AAPL finished Wednesday at 190.40 losing $1.05 (-0.55%) on low volume. Today's closing price of 190.40 marks the lowest close since July 11th. The bears were in full control today, moving the market lower throughout the whole session.
